classes.name: Client

methods.name: login
methods.description:
Logs the client in. If successful, resolves with the account's token. <warn>If you're making a bot, it's
much better to use a bot account rather than a user account.
Bot accounts have higher rate limits and have access to some features user accounts don't have. User bots
that are making a lot of API requests can even be banned.</warn>

params.name: emailOrToken
params.description:
The email or token used for the account. If it is an email, a password _must_ be
provided.

params.name: password
params.description: The password for the account, only needed if an email was provided.

properties.name: users
properties.description: A map of the Client's stored users

properties.name: guilds
properties.description: A map of the Client's stored guilds

properties.name: channels
properties.description: A map of the Client's stored channels

properties.name: token
properties.description: The authorization token for the logged in user/bot.

properties.name: user
properties.description: The ClientUser representing the logged in Client

properties.name: email
properties.description: The email, if there is one, for the logged in Client

properties.name: password
properties.description: The password, if there is one, for the logged in Client

events.name: channelUpdate
events.description: Emitted whenever a channel is updated - e.g. name change, topic change.

params.name: oldChannel
params.description: the channel before the update

params.name: newChannel
params.description: the channel after the update

events.name: guildUnavailable
events.description: Emitted whenever a guild becomes unavailable, likely due to a server outage.

params.name: guild
params.description: the guild that has become unavailable.

events.name: guildMemberRemove
events.description: Emitted whenever a member leaves a guild, or is kicked.

params.name: guild
params.description: the guild that the member has left.

params.name: member
params.description: the member that has left the guild.

events.name: guildRoleCreate
events.description: Emitted whenever a guild role is created.

params.name: guild
params.description: the guild that the role was created in.

params.name: role
params.description: the role that was created.

events.name: guildRoleDelete
events.description: Emitted whenever a guild role is deleted.

params.name: guild
params.description: the guild that the role was deleted in.

params.name: role
params.description: the role that was deleted.

events.name: guildRoleUpdated
events.description: Emitted whenever a guild role is updated.

params.name: guild
params.description: the guild that the role was updated in.

params.name: oldRole
params.description: the role before the update.

params.name: newRole
params.description: the role after the update.

events.name: guildUpdate
events.description: Emitted whenever a guild is updated - e.g. name change.

params.name: oldGuild
params.description: the guild before the update.

params.name: newGuild
params.description: the guild after the update.

events.name: messageUpdate
events.description: Emitted whenever a message is updated - e.g. embed or content change.

params.name: oldMessage
params.description: the message before the update.

params.name: newMessage
params.description: the message after the update.

events.name: userUpdate
events.description: Emitted whenever a detail of the logged in User changes - e.g. username.

params.name: oldClientUser
params.description: the client user before the update.

params.name: newClientUser
params.description: the client user after the update.

events.name: guildCreate
events.description: Emitted whenever the client joins a Guild.

params.name: guild
params.description: the created guild.

events.name: channelCreate
events.description: Emitted whenever a Channel is created.

params.name: channel
params.description: The channel that was created

events.name: channelDelete
events.description: Emitted whenever a Channel is deleted.

params.name: channel
params.description: The channel that was deleted

events.name: guildBanAdd
events.description: Emitted whenever a member is banned from a guild.

params.name: guild
params.description: The guild that the ban occurred in

params.name: user
params.description: The user that was banned

events.name: guildBanRemove
events.description: Emitted whenever a member is unbanned from a guild.

params.name: guild
params.description: The guild that the unban occurred in

params.name: user
params.description: The user that was unbanned

events.name: guildDelete
events.description: Emitted whenever a Guild is deleted/left.

params.name: guild
params.description: The guild that was deleted

events.name: guildMembersChunk
events.description: Emitted whenever a chunk of Guild members is received

params.name: guild
params.description: The guild that the chunks relate to

params.name: members
params.description: The members in the chunk

events.name: message
events.description: Emitted whenever a message is created

params.name: message
params.description: The created message

events.name: messageDelete
events.description: Emitted whenever a message is deleted

params.name: message
params.description: The deleted message

events.name: presenceUpdate
events.description: Emitted whenever a user changes one of their details or starts/stop playing a game

params.name: oldUser
params.description: the user before the presence update

params.name: newUser
params.description: the user after the presence update

events.name: guildMemberAvailable
events.description: Emitted whenever a member becomes available in a large Guild

params.name: guild
params.description: The guild that the member became available in

params.name: member
params.description: the member that became available

events.name: typingStart
events.description: Emitted whenever a user starts typing in a channel

params.name: channel
params.description: the channel the user started typing in

params.name: user
params.description: the user that started typing

events.name: typingStop
events.description: Emitted whenever a user stops typing in a channel

params.name: channel
params.description: the channel the user stopped typing in

params.name: user
params.description: the user that stopped typing

events.name: voiceStateUpdate
events.description: Emitted whenever a user changes voice state - e.g. joins/leaves a channel, mutes/unmutes.

params.name: oldMember
params.description: the member before the voice state update

params.name: newMember
params.description: the member before the voice state update

events.name: ready
events.description: Emitted when the Client becomes ready to start working

events.name: reconnecting
events.description: Emitted when the Client tries to reconnect after being disconnected

events.name: guildMemberRolesUpdate
events.description: Emitted whenever a Guild Member's Roles change - i.e. new role or removed role

params.name: guild
params.description: the guild that the update affects

params.name: oldRoles
params.description: the roles before the update

params.name: newRoles
params.description: the roles after the update

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Deletes the channel
examples:
// delete the channel
channel.delete()
 .then() // success
 .catch(console.log); // log error

properties.name: client
properties.description: The client that instantiated the Channel

properties.name: id
properties.description: The unique ID of the channel

classes.name: ClientUser
classes.description: Represents the logged in client's Discord User

methods.name: setUsername
methods.description:
Set the username of the logged in Client.
<info>Changing usernames in Discord is heavily rate limited, with only 2 requests
every hour. Use this sparingly!</info>

params.name: username
params.description: the new username

methods.name: setEmail
methods.description:
If this user is a "self bot" or logged in using a normal user's details (which should be avoided), you can set the
email here.

params.name: email
params.description: the new email

methods.name: setPassword
methods.description:
If this user is a "self bot" or logged in using a normal user's details (which should be avoided), you can set the
password here.

params.name: password
params.description: the new password

methods.name: setAvatar
methods.description: Set the avatar of the logged in Client.

params.name: avatar
params.description: the new avatar

methods.name: toString
methods.description: When concatenated with a String, this automatically concatenates the User's mention instead of the User object.
examples:
// logs: Hello from <@123456789>!
console.log(`Hello from ${user}!`);

methods.name: deleteDM
methods.description: Deletes a DM Channel (if one exists) between the Client and the User. Resolves with the Channel if successful.

methods.name: equals
methods.description:
Checks if the user is equal to another. It compares username, ID, discriminator, status and the game being played.
It is recommended to compare equality by using `user.id === user2.id` unless you want to compare all properties.

params.name: user
params.description: the user to compare

methods.name: sendMessage
methods.description: Send a message to this channel

params.name: content
params.description: the content to send

params.name: options
params.description: the options to provide

methods.name: sendTTSMessage
methods.description: Send a text-to-speech message to this channel

params.name: content
params.description: the content to send

properties.name: verified
properties.description: Whether or not this account has been verified

properties.name: email
properties.description: The email of this account

properties.name: username
properties.description: The username of the User

properties.name: id
properties.description: The ID of the User

properties.name: discriminator
properties.description: A discriminator based on username for the User

properties.name: avatar
properties.description: The ID of the user's avatar

properties.name: bot
properties.description: Whether or not the User is a Bot.

properties.name: status
properties.description:
The status of the user:

* **`online`** - user is online
* **`offline`** - user is offline
* **`idle`** - user is AFK

properties.name: game
properties.description: The game that the user is playing, `null` if they aren't playing a game.

classes.name: DMChannel
classes.description: Represents a Direct Message Channel between two users.

methods.name: toString
methods.description:
When concatenated with a String, this automatically concatenates the recipient's mention instead of the
DM channel object.

methods.name: sendMessage
methods.description: Send a message to this channel

params.name: content
params.description: the content to send

params.name: options
params.description: the options to provide

methods.name: sendTTSMessage
methods.description: Send a text-to-speech message to this channel

params.name: content
params.description: the content to send

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Deletes the channel
examples:
// delete the channel
channel.delete()
 .then() // success
 .catch(console.log); // log error

properties.name: recipient
properties.description: The recipient on the other end of the DM

properties.name: lastMessageID
properties.description: The ID of the last sent message, if available

properties.name: messages
properties.description: A Map containing the messages sent to this channel.

properties.name: client
properties.description: The client that instantiated the Channel

properties.name: id
properties.description: The unique ID of the channel

classes.name: Guild
classes.description: Represents a Guild (or a Server) on Discord.

methods.name: toString
methods.description: When concatenated with a String, this automatically concatenates the Guild's name instead of the Guild object.
examples:
// logs: Hello from My Guild!
console.log(`Hello from ${guild}!`);

// logs: Hello from My Guild!
console.log(`Hello from ' + guild + '!');

methods.name: kick
methods.description: Tries to kick a member from the guild.

params.name: member
params.description: the member to kick

methods.name: member
methods.description: Returns the GuildMember form of a User object, if the User is present in the guild.
examples:
// get the guild member of a user
const member = guild.member(message.author);

params.name: user
params.description: the user that you want to obtain the GuildMember of.

methods.name: equals
methods.description:
Whether this Guild equals another Guild. It compares all properties, so for most operations
it is advisable to just compare `guild.id === guild2.id` as it is much faster and is often
what most users need.

params.name: guild
params.description: the guild to compare

methods.name: createChannel
methods.description: Creates a new Channel in the Guild.

params.name: name
params.description: the name of the new channel.

params.name: type
params.description: the type of the new channel, either `text` or `voice`.

methods.name: createRole
methods.description: Creates a new role in the guild, as of now this is just a blank role.

methods.name: leave
methods.description: Causes the Client to leave the guild.

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Causes the Client to delete the guild.

methods.name: edit
methods.description: Updates the Guild with new information - e.g. a new name.

params.name: data
params.description: the data to update the guild with.

methods.name: setName
methods.description: Edit the name of the Guild.

params.name: name
params.description: the new name of the Guild.

methods.name: setRegion
methods.description: Edit the region of the Guild.

params.name: region
params.description: the new region of the guild.

methods.name: setVerificationLevel
methods.description: Edit the verification level of the Guild.

params.name: verificationLevel
params.description: the new verification level of the guild.

methods.name: setAFKChannel
methods.description: Edit the AFK channel of the Guild.

params.name: afkChannel
params.description: the new AFK channel.

methods.name: setAFKTimeout
methods.description: Edit the AFK timeout of the Guild.

params.name: afkTimeout
params.description: the time in seconds that a user must be idle to be considered AFK.

methods.name: setIcon
methods.description: Set a new Guild Icon.

params.name: icon
params.description: the new icon of the guild.

methods.name: setOwner
methods.description: Sets a new owner of the Guild.

params.name: owner
params.description: the new owner of the Guild.

methods.name: setSplash
methods.description: Set a new Guild Splash Logo.

params.name: splash
params.description: the new splash screen of the guild.

properties.name: client
properties.description: The Client that created the instance of the the Guild.

properties.name: members
properties.description: A Map of members that are in this Guild. The key is the member's ID, the value is the member.

properties.name: channels
properties.description: A Map of channels that are in this Guild. The key is the channel's ID, the value is the channel.

properties.name: roles
properties.description: A Map of roles that are in this Guild. The key is the role's ID, the value is the role.

properties.name: available
properties.description: Whether the Guild is available to access. If it is not available, it indicates a server outage.

properties.name: id
properties.description: The Unique ID of the Guild, useful for comparisons.

properties.name: splash
properties.description: The hash of the guild splash image, or null if no splash (VIP only)

properties.name: region
properties.description: The region the guild is located in

properties.name: name
properties.description: The name of the guild

properties.name: memberCount
properties.description: The amount of initial members in the guild.

properties.name: large
properties.description: Whether the guild is "large" (has more than 250 members)

properties.name: joinDate
properties.description: The date at which the logged-in client joined the guild.

properties.name: icon
properties.description: The hash of the guild icon, or null if there is no icon.

properties.name: features
properties.description: An array of guild features.

properties.name: emojis
properties.description: An array of guild emojis.

properties.name: afkTimeout
properties.description: The time in seconds before a user is counted as "away from keyboard".

properties.name: afkChannelID
properties.description: The ID of the voice channel where AFK members are moved.

properties.name: embedEnabled
properties.description: Whether embedded images are enabled on this guild.

properties.name: verificationLevel
properties.description: The verification level of the guild.

properties.name: owner
properties.description: The owner of the guild

properties.name: embedChannel
properties.description: The embed channel of the Guild.

classes.name: GuildChannel
classes.description: Represents a Guild Channel (i.e. Text Channels and Voice Channels)

methods.name: equals
methods.description:
Checks if this channel has the same type, topic, position, name, overwrites and ID as another channel.
In most cases, a simple `channel.id === channel2.id` will do, and is much faster too.

params.name: channel
params.description: the channel to compare this channel to

methods.name: permissionsFor
methods.description:
Gets the overall set of permissions for a user in this channel, taking into account roles and permission
overwrites.

params.name: member
params.description: the user that you want to obtain the overall permissions for

methods.name: overwritePermissions
methods.description: Overwrites the permissions for a user or role in this channel.

params.name: userOrRole
params.description: the user or role to update

params.name: config
params.description: the configuration for the update

methods.name: setName
methods.description: Set a new name for the Guild Channel

params.name: name
params.description: the new name for the guild channel

methods.name: setPosition
methods.description: Set a new position for the Guild Channel

params.name: position
params.description: the new position for the guild channel

methods.name: setTopic
methods.description: Set a new topic for the Guild Channel

params.name: topic
params.description: the new topic for the guild channel

methods.name: toString
methods.description: When concatenated with a String, this automatically concatenates the Channel's name instead of the Channel object.
examples:
// Outputs: Hello from general
console.log(`Hello from ${channel}`);

// Outputs: Hello from general
console.log('Hello from ' + ${channel});

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Deletes the channel
examples:
// delete the channel
channel.delete()
 .then() // success
 .catch(console.log); // log error

properties.name: type
properties.description: The type of the Guild Channel

properties.name: topic
properties.description: The topic of the Guild Channel, if there is one.

properties.name: position
properties.description: The position of the channel in the list.

properties.name: name
properties.description: The name of the Guild Channel

properties.name: lastMessageID
properties.description: The ID of the last message in the channel, if one was sent.

properties.name: permissionOverwrites
properties.description: A map of permission overwrites in this channel for roles and users.

properties.name: client
properties.description: The client that instantiated the Channel

properties.name: id
properties.description: The unique ID of the channel

classes.name: GuildMember
classes.description: Represents a Member of a Guild on Discord

methods.name: deleteDM
methods.description: Deletes any DM's with this Guild Member

methods.name: kick
methods.description: Kick this member from the Guild

methods.name: sendMessage
methods.description: Send a message to this channel

params.name: content
params.description: the content to send

params.name: options
params.description: the options to provide

methods.name: sendTTSMessage
methods.description: Send a text-to-speech message to this channel

params.name: content
params.description: the content to send

properties.name: client
properties.description: The client that instantiated this GuildMember

properties.name: guild
properties.description: The guild that this member is part of

properties.name: user
properties.description: The user that this guild member instance Represents

properties.name: serverDeaf
properties.description: Whether this member is deafened server-wide

properties.name: serverMute
properties.description: Whether this member is muted server-wide

properties.name: selfMute
properties.description: Whether this member is self-muted

properties.name: selfDeaf
properties.description: Whether this member is self-deafened

properties.name: voiceSessionID
properties.description: The voice session ID of this member, if any

properties.name: voiceChannelID
properties.description: The voice channel ID of this member, if any

properties.name: joinDate
properties.description: The date this member joined the guild

properties.name: roles
properties.description: A list of roles that are applied to this GuildMember

properties.name: mute
properties.description: Whether this member is muted in any way

properties.name: deaf
properties.description: Whether this member is deafened in any way

properties.name: voiceChannel
properties.description: The voice channel this member is in, if any

properties.name: id
properties.description: The ID of this User

methods.name: equals
methods.description:
Used mainly internally. Whether two messages are identical in properties. If you want to compare messages
without checking all the properties, use `message.id === message2.id`, which is much more efficient. This
method allows you to see if there are differences in content, embeds, attachments, nonce and tts properties.

params.name: message
params.description: The message to compare it to

params.name: rawData
params.description: Raw data passed through the WebSocket about this message

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Deletes the message

methods.name: edit
methods.description: Edit the content of a message

params.name: content
params.description: the new content of a message

properties.name: channel
properties.description: The channel that the message was sent in

properties.name: guild
properties.description: If the message was sent in a guild, this will be the guild the message was sent in

properties.name: client
properties.description: The client that instantiated the Message

properties.name: author
properties.description: The author of the message

properties.name: content
properties.description: The content of the message

properties.name: timestamp
properties.description: When the message was sent

properties.name: editedTimestamp
properties.description: If the message was edited, the timestamp at which it was last edited

properties.name: tts
properties.description: Whether or not the message was Text-To-Speech

properties.name: mentionEveryone
properties.description: Whether the message mentioned @everyone or not

properties.name: nonce
properties.description: A random number used for checking message delivery

properties.name: embeds
properties.description: A list of embeds in the message - e.g. YouTube Player

properties.name: attachments
properties.description: A list of attachments in the message - e.g. Pictures

properties.name: mentions
properties.description: A list of users mentioned in the message

properties.name: id
properties.description: The ID of the message (unique in the channel it was sent)

classes.name: PermissionOverwrites
classes.description: Represents a permission overwrite for a Role or Member in a Guild Channel.

properties.name: channel
properties.description: The GuildChannel this overwrite is for

properties.name: type
properties.description: The type of this overwrite

properties.name: id
properties.description: The ID of this overwrite, either a User ID or a Role ID

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Deletes the role

methods.name: edit
methods.description: Edits the role

params.name: data
params.description: the new data for the role

methods.name: setName
methods.description: Set a new name for the role

params.name: name
params.description: the new name of the role

methods.name: setColor
methods.description: Set a new color for the role

params.name: color
params.description: the new color for the role

methods.name: setHoist
methods.description: Set whether or not the role should be hoisted

params.name: hoist
params.description: whether or not to hoist the role

methods.name: setPosition
methods.description: Set the position of the role

params.name: position
params.description: the position of the role

methods.name: setPermissions
methods.description: Set the permissions of the role

params.name: permissions
params.description: the permissions of the role

methods.name: serialize
methods.description: Get an object mapping permission names to whether or not the role enables that permission
examples:
// print the serialized role
console.log(role.serialize());

methods.name: hasPermission
methods.description: Whether or not the role includes the given permission

params.name: permission
params.description: the name of the permission to test

params.name: explicit
params.description: whether or not the inclusion of the permission is explicit

properties.name: guild
properties.description: The guild that the role belongs to

properties.name: client
properties.description: The client that instantiated the role

properties.name: id
properties.description: The ID of the role (unique to the guild it is part of)

properties.name: name
properties.description: The name of the role

properties.name: color
properties.description: The base 10 color of the role

properties.name: hoist
properties.description: If true, users that are part of this role will appear in a separate category in the users list

properties.name: position
properties.description: The position of the role in the role manager

properties.name: permissions
properties.description: The evaluated permissions number

properties.name: managed
properties.description: Whether or not the role is managed by an external service

classes.name: VoiceChannel
classes.description: Represents a Server Voice Channel on Discord.

methods.name: setBitrate
methods.description: Sets the bitrate of the channel

params.name: bitrate
params.description: the new bitrate

methods.name: equals
methods.description:
Checks if this channel has the same type, topic, position, name, overwrites and ID as another channel.
In most cases, a simple `channel.id === channel2.id` will do, and is much faster too.

params.name: channel
params.description: the channel to compare this channel to

methods.name: permissionsFor
methods.description:
Gets the overall set of permissions for a user in this channel, taking into account roles and permission
overwrites.

params.name: member
params.description: the user that you want to obtain the overall permissions for

methods.name: overwritePermissions
methods.description: Overwrites the permissions for a user or role in this channel.

params.name: userOrRole
params.description: the user or role to update

params.name: config
params.description: the configuration for the update

methods.name: setName
methods.description: Set a new name for the Guild Channel

params.name: name
params.description: the new name for the guild channel

methods.name: setPosition
methods.description: Set a new position for the Guild Channel

params.name: position
params.description: the new position for the guild channel

methods.name: setTopic
methods.description: Set a new topic for the Guild Channel

params.name: topic
params.description: the new topic for the guild channel

methods.name: toString
methods.description: When concatenated with a String, this automatically concatenates the Channel's name instead of the Channel object.
examples:
// Outputs: Hello from general
console.log(`Hello from ${channel}`);

// Outputs: Hello from general
console.log('Hello from ' + ${channel});

properties.name: members
properties.description: The members in this Voice Channel.

properties.name: bitrate
properties.description: The bitrate of this voice channel

properties.name: userLimit
properties.description: The maximum amount of users allowed in this channel - 0 means unlimited.

properties.name: type
properties.description: The type of the Guild Channel

properties.name: topic
properties.description: The topic of the Guild Channel, if there is one.

properties.name: position
properties.description: The position of the channel in the list.

properties.name: name
properties.description: The name of the Guild Channel

properties.name: lastMessageID
properties.description: The ID of the last message in the channel, if one was sent.

properties.name: permissionOverwrites
properties.description: A map of permission overwrites in this channel for roles and users.

interfaces.name: TextBasedChannel
interfaces.description: Interface for classes that have text-channel-like features

methods.name: sendMessage
methods.description: Send a message to this channel

params.name: content
params.description: the content to send

params.name: options
params.description: the options to provide

methods.name: sendTTSMessage
methods.description: Send a text-to-speech message to this channel

params.name: content
params.description: the content to send

properties.name: messages
properties.description: A Map containing the messages sent to this channel.

typedefs.name: UserResolvable
typedefs.description:
Data that resolves to give a User object. This can be:
* A User object
* A User ID
* A Message (resolves to the message author)
* A Guild (owner of the guild)

typedefs.name: GuildResolvable
typedefs.description:
Data that resolves to give a Guild object. This can be:
* A Guild object

typedefs.name: GuildMemberResolvable
typedefs.description:
Data that resolves to give a GuildMember object. This can be:
* A GuildMember object
* A User object

typedefs.name: Base64Resolvable
typedefs.description:
Data that resolves to give a Base64 string, typically for image uploading. This can be:
* A Buffer
* A Base64 String

typedefs.name: ChannelResolvable
typedefs.description:
Data that can be resolved to give a Channel. This can be:
* An instance of a Channel
* An ID of a Channel

typedefs.name: StringResolvable
typedefs.description:
Data that can be resolved to give a String. This can be:
* A String
* An Array (joined with a new line delimiter to give a string)
* Any object

typedefs.name: PermissionOverwriteOptions
typedefs.description:
An object mapping permission flags to `true` (enabled) or `false` (disabled)
```js
{
 'SEND_MESSAGES': true,
 'ATTACH_FILES': false,
}
```

general.name: Getting Started
general.data:
# Welcome!
discord.js is an easy-to-use and intuitive JavaScript library that wraps around the Discord API.

## Installation
To install discord.js from npm:
```bash
npm i --save discord.js
```

To install discord.js from the master branch:
```bash
npm i --save hydrabolt/discord.js
```

To install discord.js from the development branch:
```bash
npm i --save hydrabolt/discord.js#indev
```

To install discord.js from the rewrite branch:
```bash
npm i --save hydrabolt/discord.js#indev-rewrite
```

## Tutorials
LuckyEvie, a helper in the discord.js channel, has put together a great tutorial on getting to grips with discord.js.
It's worth a read and you can find it [here.](https://eslachance.gitbooks.io/discord-js-bot-guide/content/samples/selfbots,_the_awesomest_thing_in_the_universe.html)
